Class EmployeeDAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • EmployeeDAO

  • class EmployeeDAO
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the Database Access Object, its used to bridge the application and the database and is used whenever data need to be created, retrieved, updated and deleted from the database.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Elliot Lewis

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static java.sql.Connection c 
      private static java.sql.Statement s 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EmployeeDAO()
      The EmployeeDAO constructor initialises the connection with the database and creates the statement that will be used by the queries within the class's functions.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Converts a result set containing multiple employees, to an ArrayList containing Employee objects that represent the multiple employees.

      This function converts an image object to a byte array that can be stored in an SQLite database.

                     throws java.sql.SQLException

        res - ResultSet query results to convert.
        Returns:
        Converted ResultSet.
        Throws:

      • convertEmployees

        private static java.util.ArrayList<Employee> convertEmployees(java.sql.ResultSet res)
                                                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Converts a result set containing multiple employees, to an ArrayList containing Employee objects that represent the multiple employees.
        Parameters:
        res - The ResultSet to convert.
        Returns:
        The ArrayList of converted employees.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the result set fails to iterate.

      • selectAllEmployees

        static java.util.ArrayList<Employee> selectAllEmployees()

        Returns:
        ArrayList containing Employee objects representing each database entity.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the query fails.

      • selectEmployeeByName

        static Employee selectEmployeeByName(java.lang.String name)
                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Selects employee from the SQLite database with the name matching the one passed into the function.
        Parameters:
        name - The name to query for in the SQLite database.
        Returns:
        The Employee object representing the correct employee.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the query fails.
